Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRError

exception mwr_raw2l1.errors.FileTooLong

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRFileError

Raised if file seems too long, e.g. if binary stream is not entirely consumed after reading is finished

exception mwr_raw2l1.errors.FileTooShort

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRFileError

Raised if file seems too short, e.g. if parameter n_meas > rest of buffer

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRError

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRInputError

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRError

Raised if time reference is local but UTC is required

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRFileError

exception mwr_raw2l1.errors.UnknownFlagValue

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRInputError

Raised if the value of a flag in the input files does not correspond to the range of known values

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRFileError

Raised if the filetype does not match with the chosen reader

exception mwr_raw2l1.errors.WrongInputFormat

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRInputError

Raised if format of input to a function or class does not correspond to expectations

exception mwr_raw2l1.errors.WrongNumberOfChannels

Bases: mwr_raw2l1.errors.MWRError

Raised if a wrong number of frequency channels is assumed for reading the file -> this can happen for old-version BLB files where n_freq is read after being used

mwr_raw2l1.main module

mwr_raw2l1.main.get_meas_constructor(name)

get constructor method for measurement class from name string

mwr_raw2l1.main.get_reader(name)

get data reader from name string

mwr_raw2l1.main.main(inst_config_file, nc_format_config_file, **kwargs)

main function reading in raw files, generating and processing measurement instance and writing output file

Parameters

  • inst_config_file – yaml configuration file for the instrument to process

  • nc_format_config_file – yaml configuration file defining the output NetCDF format

  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments passed over to get_files function, typically ‘time_start’ and ‘time_end’

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf module

Create NetCDF from xarray Dataset (or dictionary) according to specifications in the config file

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.generate_history_str()
mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.prepare_datavars(data, conf)

prepare xarray Dataset’s data variables for writing to file standard specified in conf

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.prepare_global_attrs(data, conf, attr_key, set_history=True)

add global attributes from configuration dictionary

Parameters

  • data – xarray.Dataset

  • conf – configuration dictionary with global attributes under the key given by attr_key

  • attr_key – string specifying the key under which attributes are stored in conf dict. Usually ‘attributes’ or ‘nc_attributes’

  • set_history – add history attribute specifying when and how file was generated. Defaults to True.

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.write(data, filename, nc_conf_file, inst_conf_file, *args, **kwargs)

wrapper picking the right writer according to the type of data

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.write_from_dict(data, filename, nc_conf_file, inst_conf_file=None, format='NETCDF4')

write data dictionary to NetCDF according to the format definition in conf_file by using the netCDF4 module

CARE: This is a legacy function here for completeness but not maintained any further.

Especially, writing of global attributes is not yet included.

mwr_raw2l1.write_netcdf.write_from_xarray(data_in, filename, conf_nc, conf_inst, format='NETCDF4', copy_data=False)

write data (Dataset) to NetCDF according to the format definition in conf_file by using the xarray module

Parameters

  • data_in – xarray Dataset or DataArray containing data to write to file

  • filename – name and path of output NetCDF file

  • conf_nc – configuration dict of yaml file defining the format and contents of the output NetCDF file

  • conf_inst – configuration dict of yaml file with instrument specifications (contains global attrs for NetCDF)

  • format – NetCDF format type of the output file. Default is NETCDF4

  • copy_data (bool) – In case of False, the dataset will experience in-place modifications which is suitable when the dataset is not used in its original form after calling the write function, for True a copy is modified. Defaults to False.
